intro: Hieracium strictifolium, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium strictifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
